summary:
Arabs are an ethnic group mainly living in West Asia and North Africa, with a rich history dating back thousands of years. They have inhabited areas like the Levant, Mesopotamia, and Arabia. Ancient Arab civilizations, such as Dilmun and Saba, were influential in trade and had close relations with neighboring regions.

The Arab world expanded significantly with the spread of Islam during the Middle Ages. Arab empires like the Umayyad and Abbasid ruled vast territories, impacting global history. Today, Arabs share a common culture, language (Arabic), and heritage, and have contributed to various fields, including science, art, and literature. Most Arabs are Muslims, but there are also Christian and other religious communities within the Arab population.
title: Arabs
